result.execSummary:
The defendant Peter M. Eckes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Repeater], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Repeater], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Repeater], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Repeater], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: This sentence is to commence forthwith, concurrent to #14CF45, but consecutive to the reconfinement in Jefferson County Case #07CF264

superMiscConds.notes:
--to pay costs of $268 plus $100 domestic abuse surcharge plus $250 DNA surcharge

**Pursuant to the Court of Appeal decision in State v. Edward, 2015 WI 51, 363 Wis.2d 628 and State v. Radaj, 2015 WI 50, 363 Wis.2d 633, and 973.13, Stats., the JOC is amended to remove the DNA surcharge(s).  Government entities shall, to the extent legally obligated to do so, comply with the courts Order to Amend Judgment of Conviction Re: DNA Surcharge(s) entered herein.**

--to undergo assessment, treatment, or counseling as required by the Agent
--to complete a Certified Batterer Intervention Program; the Court prefers that this be a group program, but leaves this to the discretion of the Agent
--to continue in treatment with a medical professional regarding the Bi-Polar condition until discharged from that treatment, and to take all prescribed medications as prescribed
--no direct or indirect contact with Carrie Ann Mooney
 or her children
--to maintain absolute sobriety from both alcohol and non-prescribed controlled substances
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--not to engage in any dating type relationships with any females without the advanced approval of the Agent
--not to reside with any females outside of family members without the advanced approval of the Agent
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or an educational program as directed by the Agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand

Arresting Agency: JCSD

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Petition for sentence adjust denied - summarily

records.addlTxt:
[MA]Case called at 11:32am
There are no appearances.

Hearing scheduled on Mr. Eckes' petition for sentence adjustment. 
The Court summarizes that it was informed that Mr. Eckes is no longer incarcerated at Red Granite Corr and had a probation review hearing for another case here in Jefferson Co. yesterday. 
The Court deems this the reasoning for no appearances by either Mr. Eckes or the State.
The Court denies the petition. 
recess: 11:33pm

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
cases #14CF5 & #14CF45 called at 2:10pm.  (separate minutes for each case) 
Defendant Peter M. Eckes in court, in custody, with Attorney John V Rhiel.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appear for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance. 

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " Guilty " entered on Counts #1, #2, #3 and #5; factual basis stipulated, including as to the Repeater status; the Court accepts the pleas, finds Mr. Eckes  guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #4. 

On Counts #1, #2, #3 & #5 each, the Court sentences Mr. Eckes to 24 months, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  12 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 12 months.  This sentence is to commence forthwith, concurrent with each other and to case #14CF45, but consecutive to the reconfinement in Jefferson County Case #07CF264.

The Court finds that Mr. Eckes is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that Mr. Eckes is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
 
The Court gives 0 days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--to undergo assessment, treatment, or counseling as required by the Agent
--to complete a Certified Batterer Intervention Program; the Court prefers that this be a group program, but leaves this to the discretion of the Agent
--to continue in treatment with a medical professional regarding the Bi-Polar condition until discharged from that treatment, and to take all prescribed medications as prescribed
--no direct or indirect contact with Carrie Ann Mooney or her children
--to maintain absolute sobriety from both alcohol and non-prescribed controlled substances
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--not to engage in any dating type relationships with any females without the advanced approval of the Agent
--not to reside with any females outside of family members without the advanced approval of the Agent
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or an educational program as directed by the Agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand
--to pay costs of $268 plus $100 domestic abuse surcharge plus $250 DNA surcharge on each count ($2472 total)


Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Contact Prohibition warnings/penalties are given 
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess 2:56pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 6, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

cases #14CF5 & #14CF45 called at 11:40am.
Defendant Peter M. Eckes in court, in custody, with Attorney John V Rhiel.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Rhiel indicates that Mr. Eckes is asking that these cases be scheduled for Plea & Sentencing as soon as possible.  The Court discusses with counsel that it will schedule the hearing for Thursday, however the State will need to promptly make efforts to notify the alleged victim.

Service of the case #14CF45 Criminal Complaint is admitted; the charge and maximum penalties are recited.

The Court orders that the bond in case #14CF5 also applies to case #14CF45. Further the Court grants the State's Motion for an order under Statute 940.07 that prohibits Mr. Eckes from communicating with Kerry Mooney except through an attorney. 
recess 11:49am. 

NEXT:  (1) ADA Hall is to submit a proposed order on the prohibition under Statute 940.07, (2) schedule both cases for Plea/Sentencing on 2/6/14 at 2:00pm. (JA- please note in comments that Waiver of Prelim has not yet occurred in case #14CF45)
Status conference on February 4, 2014 at 11:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on January 22, 2014 at 11:20 am.

case called at 9:03am. 
Defendant Peter M. Eckes in court, in custody, with Attorney John V Rhiel.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Mr. Eckes waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
recess 9:09am. 

NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 1/22/14 at 11:20am (2) schedule Status Conference if possible during the last week of January, or before February 7th if possible

ADDRESS INFO for Peter M. Eckes
Current: 411 S Center Ave, C/O Jefferson County Jail, Jefferson, WI 53549 United States  (Effective: 01-10-2014)
Prior: 213 W. Sherman Ave, Fort Atkinson, WI 53538
Preliminary hearing on January 13, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Copy of bond faxed by JCSD to COC on 1/6/14. Bond with Origianl signatures returned to COC from JCSD on 1/7/14

Case called at 1:16 pm
Defendant Peter M. Eckes in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Yelena Zarwell from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court verifies with the defendant that the DOB and address lised on the criminal complaint are correct.
Court reviews conflict review worksheet. Court concludes that there is no conflict and signs the conflict review worksheet.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; charges and maximum penalties recited
Court reviewed the criminal complaint and finds that it states probable cause to support Counts #1-#5.
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $5,000.00 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No contact with the Carrie Mooney
-No presence at N3686 CountyHwy K in the Town of Jefferson
-Defendant must appear at the Preliminary Hearing on 1/13/14 at 9:00 am

Attorney Zarwell informs the Court that the defendant qualifies for SPD representation.
Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing within 20 day time limit. (requested by the defendant)
Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 

Recess: 1:28 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
Preliminary Hearing: 1/13/14 at 9:00 am
